Note:

Package hyperSpec and it’s friends provide a number of vignettes to help you get started.

  • You can access the vignettes via these links:

    • Introduction to hyperSpec
    • Plotting Functions in hyperSpec
    • Fitting Baselines to Spectra
    • Importing Files into hyperSpec
    • flu: Example Workflow for Fluorescene Emission
    • laser: Example Workflow for Spectral Time Series

  • Alternatively, if you are offline or prefer accessing the vignettes with R, simply type browseVignettes(“hyperSpec”) to get a clickable list in a browser window.

  • Vignettes in other packages:

    • Example Workflow for 2D Raman Spectra (chondro dataset)
    • Plotting hyperSpec objects with ggplot2
    • Using dplyr functions with hyperSpec objects

1 Importing JCAMP-DX Files

hySpc.read.jdx is a small package that wraps the [readJDX::readJDX()] function. As such many different JCAMP-DX formats can be imported. [readJDX::readJDX()] has a great deal of supporting documentation and vignettes, which you should consult for detailed information.

This example shows how to read in a JCAMP-DX file. read_jdx returns a list; the first element is the file metadata, and the second element is the imported data as a hyperSpec object. Figure @ref(fig:demo_read_plot) shows the imported spectrum.

sbo <- system.file("extdata", "SBO.jdx", package = "readJDX")
data <- read_jdx(sbo)
spc <- data[[2]]
plot(spc)

(#fig:demo_read_plot)IR spectrum of Smart Balance Original spread, a butter substitute.

The metadata includes some fields required by the JCAMP-DX standard as well as fields supplied by the instrument vendor.

meta <- data[[1]]
head(meta, n = 40L)
#>  [1] "##TITLE=Smart Balance Original Spread" "##JCAMP-DX=5.01  $$ Nicolet v. 1"     
#>  [3] "##DATATYPE=INFRARED SPECTRUM"          "##ORIGIN=Lab"                         
#>  [5] "##OWNER= Public Domain"                "##LONGDATE=2016/11/22"                
#>  [7] "##TIME=10:16:17"                       "##DATA PROCESSING="                   
#>  [9] "Ratio against background"              "Truncated"                            
#> [11] "ElementMultiply or ElementDivide"      "##XUNITS=1/CM"                        
#> [13] "##YUNITS=TRANSMITTANCE"                "##FIRSTX=399.212341"                  
#> [15] "##LASTX=3999.837646"                   "##FIRSTY=0.944539"                    
#> [17] "##MAXX=3999.837646"                    "##MINX=399.212341"                    
#> [19] "##MAXY=1.059585"                       "##MINY=0.523075"                      
#> [21] "##XFACTOR=1.000000"                    "##YFACTOR=1.000000E-008"              
#> [23] "##NPOINTS=1868"                        "##DELTAX=1.928562"
